poem:
### Innocence Veiled

In the soft play's laughter,  
a shadow intrudes;  
plastic-shrouded spectres  
swing under caution's words.  
Parents' furrowed brows,  
a dance halted—  
youth's unknowing eye  
meets imagination's harsh cloth.  
Apologies whispered,  
missteps untangled,  
while childhood resumes  
its unguarded play  
upon safer ground,  
where shadows yield  
to innocence.
